subs.text: April 3
@jeffjarvis i don't get it

subs.text: One  of  these  decades  the tech industry is going to grow the fuck up and stop insisting on being the boy wonder and respect what has been accomplished before they showed up. Then we won’t have to constantly be retooling and ripping up the pavement and starting over.
subs.rawText: One  of  these  decades  the tech industry is going to grow the fuck up and stop insisting on being the boy wonder and respect what has been accomplished before they showed up. Then we won’t have to constantly be retooling and ripping up the pavement and starting over.

subs.text: I don’t buy this idea that Russia can’t lose in Ukraine, after all the United States lost in both Iraq and Afghanistan. And let’s not forget Vietnam. A big adult country doesn’t have to win every battle it chooses to fight. [link]

subs.text:
@jack In everything I read about bluesky there was no plan to use what was built with rss. 

I saw activitypub, xmpp, but no rss.

jack, as you might imagine, my work builds on rss so we’ll be competing. 

so unnecessary. Just like a bigco. Come down off your pedestal, be a mensch.

subs.text:
A user said he’d be more inclined to use Drummer if i planned for it to continue to work after I stop working. 

First, yes I did plan the best I could. All your files are in an open format which can be read by most outliners.
subs.rawText:
A user said he’d be more inclined to use Drummer if i planned for it to continue to work after I stop working. 

First, yes I did plan the best I could. All your files are in an open format which can be read by most outliners.

subs.text:
You can easily and quickly download all your files with a single command and you should do it frequently.

If you want it to keep running, help out next time there are new features, get involved in testing. Anyone can do it.
subs.rawText:

subs.text:
@FrancescoD_Ales @pierce I had a funny experience. 

I thought yesterday's show was the season finale, all the way through the ending. 

I screamed "you bastards!" -- out loud.

Then looked and found out there's one more episode to go. 

Whew.
subs.rawText:
@FrancescoD_Ales @pierce I had a funny experience. 

I thought yesterday's show was the season finale, all the way through the ending.

Then looked and found out there's one more episode to go. 

Whew.

subs.text: I sat down at the breakfast table to solve the Wordle puzzle for the day. I sad to solve it in less than a minute. Now what to do? Guess I have to get to work! ;-)
subs.rawText: I sat down at the breakfast table to solve the Wordle puzzle for the day. I sad to solve it in less than a minute. Now what to do? Guess I have to get to work! ;-)

subs.text: BTW -- I find that only my subconscious mind can solve the puzzle, to actually see the solution. I can analytically arrange for the clues to be available to my subconsciousl but the word pops into my mind in an instant. I have no awareness of what the process is.
subs.rawText: BTW -- I find that only my subconscious mind can solve the puzzle, to actually see the solution. I can analytically arrange for the clues to be available to my subconsciousl but the word pops into my mind in an instant. I have no awareness of what the process is.

subs.text: Usually I'm sure when I have the answer. Today I wasn't even sure the correct word was actually a word! What a nice surprise when all five letters came out green and then did their little dance. 😍
subs.rawText: Usually I'm sure when I have the answer. Today I wasn't even sure the correct word was actually a word! What a nice surprise when all five letters came out green and then did their little dance. 😍

subs.text: @KenSmith heh this is a question i've been asking for years. in the early days of blogging i tried to get an online news group to pop up to cover Linux. it didn't happen. as long as i was pushing it myself it had momentum, when i stepped back, nothing.
subs.rawText: @KenSmith heh this is a question i've been asking for years. in the early days of blogging i tried to get an online news group to pop up to cover Linux. it didn't happen. as long as i was pushing it myself it had momentum, when i stepped back, nothing.

subs.text:
@TaylorLorenz Taylor, I was for a while the center of the blogging world, and all the abuse we were gathering was aimed at me. 

People would figure out who I was dating, and then go after them. Same for the people who worked with me.
subs.rawText:
@TaylorLorenz Taylor, I was for a while the center of the blogging world, and all the abuse we were gathering was aimed at me. 

People would figure out who I was dating, and then go after them. Same for the people who worked with me.

subs.text:
@TaylorLorenz Eventually I deliberately cut down on my fame. To take the focus off me. A lifestyle choice. 

I don't know that there's any other way out of the problem. Writing about it publicly only makes it worse I found. Very little sympathy out there for the person at or near the top.
subs.rawText:
@TaylorLorenz Eventually I deliberately cut down on my fame. To take the focus off me. A lifestyle choice. 

I don't know that there's any other way out of the problem. Writing about it publicly only makes it worse I found. Very little sympathy out there for the person at or near the top.

subs.text: @TaylorLorenz Some of the abuse came from people who worked for the big tech companies who were threatened by the work we were doing, btw. Hard to say if the companies put them up to it, but I'm sure it didn't hurt their careers.
subs.rawText: @TaylorLorenz Some of the abuse came from people who worked for the big tech companies who were threatened by the work we were doing, btw. Hard to say if the companies put them up to it, but I'm sure it didn't hurt their careers.

subs.text:
@dkiesow @jeffjarvis @grovesprof @ImtiazBaltNews five years isn't much time for that kind of shift. 

the web didn't come about in five years, it was a stack of development that goes back to the 60s. one layer on top of another. 30 years went into it.

subs.text: I heard a BBC reporter ask a Ukrainian official if they would attack Russian military in Russia. What kind of question is that. Of course they would. It's a war. Russia attacked Ukraine. All of Russia is a fair target for the Ukraine military.

subs.text: I can’t believe that supposedly legit news orgs post stories that are supposed to be jokes but are stupid lies. They do it every year. I try to remember each one, and never to take them seriously again.
